name: Mixed Bag 28 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [C] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Varieties of what mammals include brown, black, sun and spectacled?
questions.explanation:
Bears.

	Other varieties include the sloth, grizzly and polar.

questions.text: When 'Macbeth' begins, Duncan is king of what country?
questions.explanation:
Scotland.

	King from 1034-40. Macbeth served Duncan as a general and later killed him.

questions.text: Of what magazine was fashion expert Diana Vreeland editor?
questions.explanation:
Vogue.

	'Vogue' is a woman's fashion magazine.

questions.text: What kind of award is the 'Nellie' of Canada equivalent to in the United States?
questions.explanation:
Oscar.

	'And the winner is'? Hats off to the movies.

questions.text: In the Bible how old was Sarah when she died?
questions.explanation:
127.

	She was half sister and wife of Abraham and gave birth to Isaac at the biblical age of 90.

questions.text: Alaska is what size compared to the rest of the United States?
questions.explanation:
One fifth.

	About one fifth with a total area of 615,230 square miles.

questions.text: What school does the 'Peanuts' gang attend?
questions.explanation:
Birchwood.

	One of America's favorite comics.

questions.text: What was the original name of Mighty Mouse?
questions.explanation:
Super Mouse.

	He became Mighty Mouse in 1945.

questions.text: According to the Bible who was the first farmer?
questions.explanation:
Adam.

	Adam became the first farmer when cast out of Eden.  He was followed in his profession by Cain, the elder son of Adam and Eve and Abel's brother. Cain slew Abel and became the first murderer.

Safety pin.

	The safety pin was invented in 1849.
